name: Msdos
description: Cheat Sheet for Windows Command Prompt

Basic Command Prompt Commands.val: provides syntax info and complete list of all parameters for x (a command, like 'cd')
change directory
move to the parent directory
move to the root of current drive
move to the current\x directory
change to the z root directory (as opposed to c:)
copy file x to directory y (Ex: D:\games\galaga.exe C:\programs[\awesome.exe]), [] = optional
display file contents in console
create text file in the console window, end with ctrl+z (^z or F6)
change the date
delete/erase
deletes all files/folders fitting x
deletes all files within current directory
deletes all files within current directory
display contents of current directory (Ex: dir [c:][\programs]), [] = optional
list all .txt files in current directory
list all files with extensions one character in length in current directory
display all contents one screen at a time
display all contents one line at a time
provides syntax info and complete list of all dir parameters
send command line input to display (by default)
append line(s) of text to any file
overwrites file with sometext
delete/erase
exit the command prompt
opens filename.txt in current directory in Notepad (or default .txt program)
format z drive [Ex: use to format a disc or flash drive]
make directory x in current directory
more or rename x to y
escapes sequential display of contents (i.e. the more parameter)
remove/delete directory x if it’s empty
rename file x to y
change the time
display the contents of the file ‘file’ (displays file contents in console)
display the contents one line at a time
